<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Includes $853.2&nbsp;million of charges (U.S.&#151;$99.2; Europe&#151;$147.8; APMEA&#151;$222.3; Latin America&#151;$142.3;
Canada&#151;$9.7; Partner Brands&#151;$34.0; and Corporate&#151;$197.9) primarily related to restructuring markets and eliminating positions, restaurant closings/asset impairment
and the write-off of technology costs. See other operating (income) expense, net note for further discussion.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Includes $377.6&nbsp;million of charges (U.S.&#151;$181.0; Europe&#151;$45.8; APMEA&#151;$41.5; Latin America&#151;$40.4; Canada&#151;$9.8;
Partner Brands&#151;$24.9; and Corporate&#151;$34.2) primarily related to the U.S. business reorganization and other global change initiatives, and restaurant closings/asset impairment.
See other operating (income) expense, net note for further discussion.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total long-lived assets, primarily property and equipment, were (in millions)&#151;Consolidated: 2002&#151;$21,976.6;
2001&#151;$20,355.3; 2000&#151;$19,798.3. U.S. based: 2002&#151;$9,254.3; 2001&#151;$8,670.4; 2000&#151;$8,373.2. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>DEBT FINANCING  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>LINE OF CREDIT AGREEMENTS </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At
December&nbsp;31, 2002, the Company had several line of credit agreements with various banks totaling $1.3&nbsp;billion, all of which remained unused at year-end 2002. Subsequent to
year end, the Company renegotiated the line of credit agreements as follows: $810.0&nbsp;million of lines expiring in 2004 with a term of 364&nbsp;days and fees based on current credit ratings of
..05% per annum on the total commitment, with a feature that allows the Company to convert the borrowings to a one-year loan at expiration; a $500.0&nbsp;million line expiring in 2008
with fees based on current credit ratings of .07% per annum on the total commitment; and a $25.0&nbsp;million line expiring in 2003 with a term of 364&nbsp;days and fees of .07% per annum on the
total commitment. Fees and interest rates on these lines are based on the Company's long-term credit rating assigned by Moody's and Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's. Under terms of these
agreements, the Company is required to maintain a minimum net worth (defined as consolidated assets less consolidated liabilities) of $5&nbsp;billion. In addition, certain subsidiaries outside the
U.S. had unused lines of credit totaling $1.1&nbsp;billion at December&nbsp;31, 2002; these were principally short-term and denominated in various currencies at local market rates of
interest. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
weighted-average interest rate of short-term borrowings, consisting of commercial paper and foreign currency bank line borrowings, was 3.4% at both December&nbsp;31,
2002 and December&nbsp;31, 2001. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>FAIR VALUES </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At
December&nbsp;31, 2002, the fair value of the Company's debt and notes payable obligations was estimated at $10.5&nbsp;billion compared to a carrying amount of $10.0&nbsp;billion. This fair
value was estimated using various pricing models or discounted cash flow analyses that incorporated quoted market prices. The Company has no current plans to retire a significant amount of its debt
prior to maturity. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
carrying amounts for both cash and equivalents and notes receivable approximate fair value. Foreign currency and interest-rate exchange agreements, foreign currency
options and forward foreign exchange contracts were recorded in the Consolidated balance sheet at fair value using various pricing models or discounted cash flow analyses that incorporated quoted
market prices. No fair value was estimated for noninterest-bearing security deposits by franchisees, because these deposits are an integral part of the overall franchise arrangements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>ESOP LOANS AND OTHER GUARANTEES </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At
December&nbsp;31, 2002, the Company has guaranteed and included in total debt $22.6&nbsp;million of Notes issued by the Leveraged Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) with payments through
2006. Borrowings related to the ESOP at December&nbsp;31, 2002, which include $85.9&nbsp;million of loans from the Company to the ESOP and the $22.6&nbsp;million of Notes guaranteed by the
Company, are reflected as long-term debt with a corresponding reduction of shareholders' equity (unearned ESOP compensation). The ESOP is repaying the loans and interest through 2018 using
Company contributions and dividends from its McDonald's common stock holdings. As the principal amount of the borrowings is repaid, the debt and the unearned ESOP compensation are being reduced. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>35</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=35,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=354765,FOLIO='35',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]DU1918A.;17',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;10:30' -->
<A NAME="page_du1918_1_36"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company also has guaranteed certain affiliate and other loans totaling $102.0&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2002. These guarantees are contingent commitments issued by the
Company generally to support borrowing arrangements of certain U.S. partnerships and franchisees, and certain affiliates. The terms of the guarantees vary and are equal to the remaining term of the
related debt. At December&nbsp;31, 2002, there was no carrying value for obligations under these guarantees in the Company's Consolidated balance sheet. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>DEBT OBLIGATIONS </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company has incurred debt obligations principally through public and private offerings and bank loans. There are no provisions in the Company's debt obligations that would accelerate repayment of
debt as a result of a change in credit ratings. Certain of the Company's debt obligations contain cross-acceleration provisions and restrictions on Company and subsidiary mortgages and the
long-term debt of certain subsidiaries. Under certain agreements, the Company has the option to retire debt prior to maturity, either at par or at a premium over par. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following table summarizes the Company's debt obligations (the interest rates reflected in the table include the effects of interest-rate and foreign currency exchange
agreements). </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Weighted-average effective rate, computed on a semiannual basis.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Includes $150&nbsp;million of debentures that mature in 2027, which are subordinated to senior debt and which provide for the ability to defer interest payments up to
five years
under certain conditions.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> A portion of U.S. Dollar fixed-rate debt effectively has been converted into other currencies and/or into floating-rate debt through the use of exchange
agreements. The rates shown reflect the fixed rate on the receivable portion of the exchange agreements. All other obligations in this table reflect the net effects of these and other exchange
agreements.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(4)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Primarily consists of Swiss Francs, Swedish Kronor and Danish Kroner.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(5)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Primarily consists of Korean Won, Chinese Renminbi, New Taiwanese Dollars and Hong Kong Dollars.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(6)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Aggregate maturities for 2002 debt balances, before fair value adjustments, are as follows: 2003&#151;$337.4; 2004&#151;$974.8; 2005&#151;$2,016.7;
2006&#151;$1,013.6; 2007&#151;$662.7; and thereafter&#151;$4,609.4. These amounts include reclassifications of short-term obligations to long-term
obligations of $810.0 in 2005 and $500.0 thereafter, as they are supported by the long-term line of credit agreements discussed on page&nbsp;35.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(7)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> SFAS No.&nbsp;133 requires that the underlying items in fair value hedges, in this case debt obligations, be recorded at fair value. The related hedging instrument is
also recorded
at fair value in either miscellaneous other assets or other long-term liabilities. A portion ($155.9&nbsp;million) of the adjustments at December&nbsp;31, 2002 related to
interest-rate exchange agreements that were terminated in December&nbsp;2002 and will amortize as a reduction to interest expense over the remaining life of the related debt.
<BR> </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(8)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I> Includes notes payable, current maturities of long-term debt and long-term debt included in the Consolidated balance sheet. The increase in debt obligations
from December&nbsp;31, 2001 to December&nbsp;31, 2002 was due to the impact of changes in exchange rates on foreign currency-denominated debt ($645.0&nbsp;million), SFAS No.&nbsp;133 fair
value adjustments ($270.9&nbsp;million) and an increase in net borrowings ($145.5&nbsp;million).  </I></FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation and amortization expense was (in millions): 2002&#151;$971.1; 2001&#151;$945.6; 2000&#151;$900.9. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Company's Profit Sharing and Savings Plan for U.S.-based employees includes profit sharing, 401(k) and leveraged employee stock ownership (ESOP) features. The 401(k) feature
allows participants to make pretax contributions that are partly matched from shares released under the ESOP. McDonald's executives, staff and restaurant managers participate in additional ESOP
allocations and profit sharing contributions, based on their compensation. The profit sharing contribution is discretionary, and the Company determines the amount each year. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>36</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=36,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=956765,FOLIO='36',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]DU1918A.;17',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;10:30' -->
<A NAME="page_du1918_1_37"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Participant
401(k) contributions, the Company's matching contributions, profit sharing contributions and any related earnings can be invested in McDonald's common stock or among several
other investment alternatives. ESOP allocations are generally invested in McDonald's common stock. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
addition, the Company maintains a nonqualified, unfunded Supplemental Plan that allows participants to make tax-deferred contributions and receive Company-provided
allocations that cannot be made under the Profit Sharing and Savings Plan because of Internal Revenue Service limitations. The investment alternatives and returns in the Supplemental Plan are based on
certain of the investment alternatives under the Profit Sharing and Savings Plan. Total liabilities under the Supplemental Plan were $297.3&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2002 and
$301.1&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2001 and were included in other long-term liabilities in the Consolidated balance sheet. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company has entered into derivative contracts to hedge changes in the Supplemental Plan liabilities. At December&nbsp;31, 2002, derivatives with a fair value of
$34.5&nbsp;million indexed to the Company's stock and $38.4&nbsp;million indexed to certain market indices were included in miscellaneous other assets in the Consolidated balance sheet. All
changes in Plan liabilities and in the fair value of the derivatives are recorded in selling, general&nbsp;&amp; administrative expenses. Changes in fair value of the derivatives indexed to the
Company's stock are recorded in the Consolidated statement of income because the contracts provide the counterparty with a choice of cash settlement or settlement in shares. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total
U.S. costs for the Profit Sharing and Savings Plan, including nonqualified benefits and related hedging activities, were (in millions): 2002&#151;$50.1;
2001&#151;$54.6; 2000&#151;$49.6. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain
subsidiaries outside the U.S. also offer profit sharing, stock purchase or other similar benefit plans. Total plan costs outside the U.S. were (in millions):
2002&#151;$36.8; 2001&#151;$39.7; 2000&#151;$38.1. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
postretirement benefits and postemployment benefits, excluding severance benefits related to the 2002 and 2001 restructuring charges, were immaterial. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>STOCK OPTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>At December&nbsp;31, 2002, the Company had five stock-based compensation plans for employees and nonemployee directors. Options to purchase common stock are granted at the
fair market value of the stock on the date of grant. Therefore, no compensation cost has been recognized in the Consolidated statement of income for these plans. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Substantially
all of the options become exercisable in four equal installments, beginning a year from the date of the grant, and expire 10&nbsp;years from the grant date. In 2001, the
Board of Directors approved a three-year extension to the term of 44.2&nbsp;million options granted between May&nbsp;1, 1999 and December&nbsp;31, 2000 with an exercise price greater
than $28.90. Because the market value of the stock was less than the exercise price of the options at the time of extension, no compensation expense was required to be recorded. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also
in 2001, the Board of Directors approved a special grant of 11.9&nbsp;million options at a price of $28.90 as an incentive to meet an operating income performance goal for
calendar year 2003. The options vest on January&nbsp;31, 2004, and if the performance goal is met, the options will retain their original 10-year term; otherwise, they will expire on
June&nbsp;30, 2004. The Company does not expect to meet this performance goal. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
December&nbsp;31, 2002, the number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the plans was 231.9&nbsp;million, including 33.0&nbsp;million available for future
grants. A summary of the status of the Company's plans as of December&nbsp;31, 2002, 2001 and 2000, and changes during the years then ended, is presented in the following table. </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Includes the special grant in 2001 of 11.9&nbsp;million options discussed above.  </I></FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options granted each year were 2.1%, 3.0% and 2.0% of weighted-average common shares outstanding for 2002, 2001 and 2000, representing grants to
approximately 13,900, 15,100, and 14,100 employees in those three years. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
following table presents information related to options outstanding and options exercisable at December&nbsp;31, 2002, based on ranges of exercise prices. </FONT></P>

<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes the following pretax charges totaling $0.52 per share:
<BR> </I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>&#149;</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> $266.9&nbsp;million ($243.6&nbsp;million after tax) primarily related to transferring ownership in four countries in the Middle East and Latin America,
ceasing operations in three countries in Latin America and eliminating positions, reallocating resources and consolidating certain home office facilities to control costs.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$359.4&nbsp;million ($292.8&nbsp;million after tax) consisting of $292.2&nbsp;million related to management's decision to close
719 underperforming restaurants (202 were closed in 2002 and 517 will close throughout 2003), mainly in the U.S. and Japan, and $67.2&nbsp;million primarily related to the impairment of assets for
certain existing restaurants in Europe and Latin America.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$183.9&nbsp;million ($120.5&nbsp;million after tax) consisting of $170.0&nbsp;million related to management's decision to
terminate a long-term technology project, and $13.9&nbsp;million primarily related to the write-off of receivables and inventory in Venezuela as a result of the temporary
closure of all McDonald's restaurants due to the national strike that began in early December.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes the following pretax charges totaling $0.13 per share:</I></FONT><BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$200.0&nbsp;million ($136.1&nbsp;million after tax) related to strategic changes and restaurant initiatives in the U.S. and
certain international markets.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$25.0&nbsp;million ($17.0&nbsp;million after tax) primarily related to unrecoverable costs incurred in connection with the theft
of winning game pieces and the related termination of the supplier.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$27.1&nbsp;million ($18.4&nbsp;million after tax) consisting of a $20.0&nbsp;million asset impairment charge related to the
disposition of Aroma Caf&eacute; and $7.1&nbsp;million primarily related to the closing of nine underperforming restaurants in international markets.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(3)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes the following pretax charges totaling $101.5&nbsp;million:</I></FONT><BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$84.1&nbsp;million ($63.9&nbsp;million after tax) primarily related to the closing of 154 underperforming restaurants in
international markets.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>$17.4&nbsp;million ($12.1&nbsp;million after tax) primarily related to the write-off of certain
technology.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(4)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes a $24.0&nbsp;million asset impairment charge (pre and after tax or $0.01 per share) in Turkey.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(5)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes $43.0&nbsp;million of asset impairment charges (pre and after tax or $0.03 per share), primarily related to the impairment of assets in existing
restaurants in Chile and other Latin American markets and the closing of 32 underperforming restaurants in Turkey, as a result of continuing economic weakness.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(6)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Includes net pretax income of $23.2&nbsp;million ($53.0&nbsp;million of income after tax or $0.04 per share) consisting of the $101.5&nbsp;million pretax
charges noted in (3)&nbsp;above, a $137.1&nbsp;million gain (pre and after tax) on the initial public offering of McDonald's Japan and a $12.4&nbsp;million pretax charge ($8.1&nbsp;million
after tax) primarily related to the write-off of a corporate investment.</I></FONT><BR>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(7)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I>Systemwide sales include sales by all restaurants, whether operated by the Company, by franchisees or by affiliates operating under joint-venture agreements.
See page 11 for further discussion.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>38</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=38,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=519531,FOLIO='38',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]DU1918B.;16',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;10:30' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_dw1918_1_39"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>MANAGEMENT'S REPORT  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Management is responsible for the preparation, integrity and fair presentation of the consolidated financial statements and notes to the consolidated financial statements. The
financial statements were prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the U.S. and include certain amounts based on management's judgment and best estimates. Other
financial information presented is consistent with the financial statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Company maintains a system of internal controls over financial reporting including safeguarding of assets against unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition, which is designed to
provide reasonable assurance to the Company's management and Board of Directors regarding the preparation of reliable published financial statements and asset safeguarding. The system includes a
documented organizational structure and appropriate division of responsibilities; established policies and procedures that are communicated throughout the Company; careful selection, training, and
development of our people; and utilization of an internal audit program. Policies and procedures prescribe that the Company and all employees are to maintain high standards of proper business
practices throughout the world. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
are inherent limitations to the effectiveness of any system of internal control, including the possibility of human error and the circumvention or overriding of controls.
Accordingly, even an effective internal control system can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and safeguarding of assets. Furthermore, the effectiveness
of an internal control system can change with circumstances. The Company believes that it maintains an effective system of internal control over financial reporting and safeguarding of assets against
unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
consolidated financial statements have been audited by independent auditors, Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP, who were given unrestricted access to all financial records and related data.
The audit report of Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP is presented herein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Board of Directors, operating through its Audit Committee composed entirely of independent Directors, provides oversight to the financial reporting process. Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP
has unrestricted access to the Audit Committee and regularly meets with the Committee to discuss accounting, auditing and financial reporting matters. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>McDONALD'S
CORPORATION<BR>
January&nbsp;23, 2003 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>REPORT OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The Board of Directors and Shareholders<BR>
McDonald's Corporation </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>We
have audited the accompanying Consolidated balance sheets of McDonald's Corporation as of December&nbsp;31, 2002 and 2001, and the related Consolidated statements of income, shareholders' equity
and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2002. These financial statements are the responsibility of McDonald's Corporation management. Our responsibility is
to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
conducted our audits in accordance with auditing standards generally accepted in the U.S. Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance
about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An
audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our
audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of McDonald's Corporation at December&nbsp;31,
2002 and 2001, and the consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2002, in conformity with accounting principles
generally accepted in the U.S. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
discussed in the Notes to the consolidated financial statements, effective January&nbsp;1, 2002, the Company changed its method for accounting for goodwill to conform with SFAS
No.&nbsp;142, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Goodwill and Other Intangible Assets</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Effective January&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company changed its method for accounting for derivative
financial instruments to conform with SFAS No.&nbsp;133, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>ERNST&nbsp;&amp;
YOUNG LLP<BR>
Chicago, Illinois<BR>
January&nbsp;23, 2003 </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Part&nbsp;IV  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="dw1918_item_14._control_and_procedures"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_dw1918_7"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;CONTROL AND PROCEDURES    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Within the 90-day period prior to the filing of this report, an evaluation was conducted under the supervision and with the participation of the Company's
management, including the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures. Based on that
evaluation, the CEO and CFO have concluded that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures are effective to ensure that information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports that it
files or submits under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in Securities and Exchange Commission rules and forms. Such
officers also confirm that there have been no significant changes in the Company's internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of the
evaluation referred to above. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>*</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Denotes
compensatory plan. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>**</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Other
instruments defining the rights of holders of long-term debt of the registrant and all of its subsidiaries for which consolidated financial statements are required to
be filed and which are not required to be registered with the Commission are not included herein as the securities authorized under these instruments, individually, do not exceed 10% of the total
assets of the registrant and its subsidiaries on a consolidated basis. An agreement to furnish a copy of any such instruments to the Commission upon request has been filed with the Commission. </FONT></DD></DL>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=43,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="1",CHK=80016,FOLIO='43',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]JC1918A.;13',USER='FLANGST',CD='12-MAR-2003;04:10' -->

NAME="page_je1918_1_44"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="je1918_certifications"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_je1918_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Certifications    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
James R. Cantalupo, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of McDonald's Corporation, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of McDonald's Corporation; </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of
the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report; </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(3)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this annual report; </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(4)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and have: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>designed
such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others
within those entities, particularly during the period in which this annual report is being prepared; </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90&nbsp;days prior to the filing date of this annual report (Evaluation Date); </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>presented
in this annual report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the Evaluation Date; </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(5)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of
directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>all
significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial
data and have identified for the registrant's auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal controls; and </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(6)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officers and I have indicated in this annual report whether there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that could
significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Date:
March&nbsp;12, 2003 </FONT></P>

Rules&nbsp;13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and have: </FONT>

within those entities, particularly during the period in which this annual report is being prepared; </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90&nbsp;days prior to the filing date of this annual report (Evaluation Date); </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>presented

registrant's other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of
directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>all
significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial
data and have identified for the registrant's auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal controls; and </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>

registrant's other certifying officers and I have indicated in this annual report whether there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that could
significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></DD></DL>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.(C)(I)
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>a2105107zex-10_ci.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.(C)(I)
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#03CHI1918_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kc1918_1_46"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc1918_exhibit_10(c)(i)._first_amendm__exh03825"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc1918_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10(c)(i). FIRST AMENDMENT TO McDONALD'S CORPORATION SUPPLEMENTAL PROFIT SHARING AND SAVINGS PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>The McDonald's Corporation Supplemental Profit Sharing and Savings Plan is hereby amended, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2002, by adding new Sections&nbsp;11 and 12,
reading in their entirety as follows:</I></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2>SECTION&nbsp;11. SPECIAL PROVISIONS FOR REHIRED EMPLOYEES</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
11.1</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%"><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Deferral Elections of Rehired Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant's employment is terminated after the Participant has made a Deferral Election and the Participant is rehired in a position making him or her
again eligible to be a Participant in this Plan, then (a)&nbsp;if the Participant's return to work occurs during the calendar year of such termination or the following calendar year, such Deferral Election shall automatically be effective with
respect to compensation of the Participant from and after the date of rehire, to the extent it is applicable thereto by its terms, and (b)&nbsp;in all other cases, such Deferral Election shall have no application.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
11.2</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%"><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Payments to Rehired Participants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Participant whose employment has terminated is rehired at any time thereafter, then all payments from the Participant's Account required to be made as a result of
the Participant's termination of employment shall cease as of the date of rehire, any Payment Election that was previously in effect for the Participant under this Plan shall be null and void, and the Participant shall be permitted to make a new
Payment Election in accordance with Article&nbsp;6, which shall apply to the Participant's entire Account.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
SECTION&nbsp;12. CLAIMS PROCEDURES</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
12.1</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%"><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Filing a Claim.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant or beneficiary of a Participant who believes that he or she is eligible for a benefit under this Plan that has not been provided may submit a written claim for benefits to
the Committee. The Committee shall evaluate each properly filed claim and notify the claimant of the approval or denial of the claim within 90&nbsp;days after the Committee receives the claim, unless special circumstances require an extension of time
for processing the claim. If an extension of time for processing the claim is required, the Committee shall provide the claimant with written notice of the extension before the expiration of the initial 90-day period, specifying the circumstances
requiring an extension and the date by which a final decision will be reached (which date shall not be later than 180&nbsp;days after the date on which the Committee received the claim). If a claim is denied in whole or in part, the Committee shall
provide the claimant with a written notice setting forth (a)&nbsp;the specific reasons for the denial, (b)&nbsp;references to pertinent Plan provisions upon which the denial is based, (c)&nbsp;a description of any additional material or information
needed and an explanation of why such material or information is necessary, and (d)&nbsp;the claimant's right to seek review of the denial pursuant to Section&nbsp;12.2 below.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
12.2.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="94%"><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Review of Claim Denial.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a claim is denied, in whole or in part, the claimant shall have the right to (a)&nbsp;request that the Committee review the denial, (b)&nbsp;review pertinent documents, and
(c)&nbsp;submit issues and comments in writing, provided that the claimant files a written request for review with the Committee within 60&nbsp;days after the date on which the claimant received written notice from the Committee of the denial. Within
60&nbsp;days after the Committee receives a properly filed request for review, the Committee shall conduct such review and advise the claimant in writing of its decision on review, unless special circumstances require an extension of time for
conducting the review. If an extension of time for conducting the review is required, the Committee shall provide the claimant with written notice of the extension before the expiration of the initial 60-day period, specifying the circumstances
requiring an extension and the date by which such review shall be completed (which date shall not be later than 120&nbsp;days after the date on which the Committee received the request for review). The Committee shall inform the claimant of its
decision on review in a written notice, setting forth the specific reason(s) for the decision and reference to Plan provisions upon which the decision is based. A decision on review shall be final and binding on all persons for all
purposes.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>46</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

NAME="page_ke1918_1_47"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ke1918_exhibit_10(g)._executive_retention_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ke1918_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10(g). EXECUTIVE RETENTION PLAN    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>As amended and restated December&nbsp;18, 2002</I></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4><FONT SIZE=2>INTRODUCTION</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
McDonald's Corporation, a Delaware corporation (the "Company"), has established the Executive Retention Plan (this "Plan") effective as of October&nbsp;1, 1998 (the "Effective Date"). This Plan was amended and restated on March&nbsp;20, 2001,
March&nbsp;20, 2002, October&nbsp;29, 2002 and December&nbsp;18, 2002. The amendments made to this Plan by the amendment and restatement of October&nbsp;29, 2002 are not applicable to any Executive (as defined in the Plan before October&nbsp;29,
2002) whose termination of employment or Change-in-Status Date (as defined in the Plan before October&nbsp;29, 2002) occurred before October&nbsp;29, 2002, for whom the Plan provisions as in effect on the date of his or her termination of employment
or Change-in-Status Date, as applicable, shall control.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
ARTICLE&nbsp;1. PURPOSE; EMPLOYMENT PERIODS GENERALLY</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
1.01</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Purpose.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to assure that the Company has the continued dedication of its key executives in a highly competitive global marketplace. This
Plan is established to promote the retention of these key executives and provide the Company with a smooth succession process. This Plan is also intended to provide these key executives with incentives that are designed to focus their energy on
contributing to the ultimate success of the Company.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
1.02</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Employment Periods.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Definition of Employment Periods.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan provides for the continued employment, subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, of the individuals identified on Appendix&nbsp;A as "Tier&nbsp;I
Executives," "Tier&nbsp;II Executives" and "Tier&nbsp;III Executives" (collectively, the "Executives") during three successive periods, each of which is defined below: the Retention Period; the Transition Period; and the Continued Employment Period
(collectively referred to as the "Employment Periods").</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Requirement of Execution of Agreement and Continued Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to be eligible for continued employment during each successive Employment Period, with the pay and benefits set forth herein, an
Executive must satisfy the requirements summarized in this Section&nbsp;1.02(b) and more fully set forth below in the Plan. The Executive must properly execute the following agreements (each, an "Agreement") at the following times: (i)&nbsp;on or
before the Executive's Change in Status Date, an Agreement substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;A (a "Transition Period Agreement"); (ii)&nbsp;on or before the first day of the Executive's Continued Employment Period, an Agreement
substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;B (a "Continued Employment Period Agreement"); and (iii)&nbsp;upon a termination of the Executive's employment at the end of the Continued Employment Period or under circumstances described in
Section&nbsp;7.01 below, an Agreement substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit&nbsp;C (a "Termination Agreement"). In addition, the Executive must not revoke, and must comply with, such Agreements. Finally, the Executive must otherwise comply
with the requirements of this Plan. An Executive may also be eligible in some cases for certain pay and benefits upon termination of his or her employment, as more fully set forth in Articles 6 and 7 below (the "Termination Benefits"). Exhibit&nbsp;B
to each Agreement shall be completed by the Company at the time of the Agreement's preparation by the insertion of a list of the "Specified Competitors," consisting of twenty-five (25)&nbsp;competitors of McDonald's determined by the Company in its
sole discretion.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Violations by the Executive.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If an Executive commits a "Violation" (as defined below), the Company shall be entitled to cancel any and all future obligations of the Company to the Executive under this
Plan and recoup the value of all Relevant Prior Benefits (as defined below), together with the Company's costs and reasonable attorney's fees. In addition, the Company shall be entitled to pursue any other remedy available to enforce the terms of the
Executive's Agreements. A "Violation" shall have occurred if an Executive (i)&nbsp;files a lawsuit, charge, complaint or other claim asserting any claim or demand within the scope of the releases given in any of his or her Agreements, (ii)&nbsp;fails
properly to execute and deliver a required Agreement, or (iii)&nbsp;purports to revoke any of his or her Agreements The "Relevant Prior Benefits" means (i)&nbsp;in the case of a Violation committed by an Executive during an Employment Period, all
payments and benefits that have been provided to the Executive under this Plan during that Employment Period, and (ii)&nbsp;in the case of a Violation committed by an Executive after termination of the Executive's employment, all Termination Benefits
provided to the Executive under the Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- insert table folio -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>47</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=364612,FOLIO='47',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KE1918A.;13',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;11:02' -->
<A NAME="page_ke1918_1_48"> </A>
<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Status and Benefits Generally during Employment Periods.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During an Executive's continued employment during each of his or her Employment Periods, except as otherwise specifically provided in this Plan:
(i)&nbsp;the Executive shall be entitled to participate in the Company's employee compensation plans, practices, policies and programs as in effect from time to time, including without limitation all equity compensation, bonus and other incentive
compensation plans, policies and programs (collectively, the "Compensation Plans"), to the extent that the Executive is eligible under, and in accordance with, the applicable terms and conditions thereof as modified by this Plan; and (ii)&nbsp;the
Executive shall be entitled to participate in the Company's employee benefit plans, practices, policies and programs as in effect from time to time (collectively, the "Employee Plans"), to the extent that the Executive is eligible under, and in
accordance with, the applicable terms and conditions thereof. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, except as specifically provided in Section&nbsp;7.01(b) below, during an Executive's Employment Periods and upon and following the
termination of his or her employment for any reason, the Executive's stock options shall continue to vest, be exercisable, expire and otherwise be subject to the express terms of the related stock option plan and the applicable Golden M Certificate
(or other applicable award agreement).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(e)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Deferred Compensation Plans.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Without limiting the generality of Section&nbsp;1.02(d) above, except as specifically provided in Section&nbsp;4.02(b) below, amounts paid to an Executive during the
Executive's Employment Periods shall be treated as "compensation" for purposes of the McDonald's Corporation Profit Sharing and Savings Plan, McDonald's Corporation Supplemental Profit Sharing and Savings Plan and any successor or other deferred
compensation plans for which the Executive may be eligible (collectively, the "Deferred Compensation Plans") and all life insurance benefit plans sponsored by McDonald's Corporation, in each case to the extent permitted by the terms of such plans as
in effect from time to time. No requirement that the Company make payments under this Plan to an Executive shall be considered violated by the Company's crediting all or any portion thereof to the Executive's account under any Deferred Compensation
Plan in which the Executive is eligible to participate, to the extent that the Executive has elected to defer such payment under the terms of such Deferred Compensation Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
ARTICLE&nbsp;2. PLAN ADMINISTRATION</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.01</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
The Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company (the "Board"), as such committee is constituted from time to time (the "Committee"), shall have overall responsibility
for the establishment, amendment, administration and operation of this Plan. The Committee shall have the responsibilities and duties and powers under this Plan which are not specifically delegated to anyone else, including without limitation the
following powers:</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
subject to any limitations under this Plan or applicable law, to make and enforce such rules and regulations of this Plan and prescribe the use of such forms as it shall deem necessary for the efficient administration of this Plan;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
to require any person to furnish such information as it may reasonably request as a condition to receiving any benefit under this Plan;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(iii)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
to decide on questions concerning this Plan;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(iv)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
to amend Appendix&nbsp;A hereto to add additional Executives, to delete Executives whose employment has terminated without the right to receive any additional benefits under this Plan or whose rights hereunder have been satisfied in full, and to
reflect any changes that are agreed with the affected Executives;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(v)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
to compute or cause to be computed the amount of benefits which shall be payable to any person in accordance with the provisions of this Plan; and</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(vi)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
to appoint and remove, as it deems advisable, the Plan Administrator.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.02</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
The Plan Administrator.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may appoint a Plan Administrator who may (but need not) be a member of the Committee, and in the absence of such appointment, the Committee shall be the Plan
Administrator. The Plan Administrator shall perform the administrative responsibilities delegated to the Plan Administrator from time to time by the Committee.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.03</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Discretionary Power of the Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee from time to time may establish rules for the administration of this Plan. The Committee shall have the sole discretion to make decisions and take any
action with respect to questions arising in connection with this Plan, including without limitation the construction and interpretation of this Plan and the determination of eligibility for and the amount of benefits under this Plan. The decisions or
actions of the Committee as to any questions arising in connection with this Plan, including without limitation the construction and interpretation of this Plan, shall be final and binding upon all Executives and their respective
beneficiaries.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- insert table folio -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>48</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=1032903,FOLIO='48',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KE1918A.;13',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;11:02' -->
<A NAME="page_ke1918_1_49"> </A>
<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.04</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Action of the Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may act at a meeting, including without limitation a telephonic meeting, by the consent of a majority of the members of the Committee at the time in office, or
without a meeting, by the unanimous written consent of the individual members of the Committee. An executed document signed by an individual member of the Committee and transmitted by facsimile shall be valid as the original signed document for all
purposes. Any person dealing with the Committee shall be entitled to rely upon a certificate of any member of the Committee, or the Secretary or any Assistant Secretary of the Company, as to any act or determination of the Committee.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.05</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Advisors and Agents of the Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may, subject to periodic review, (a)&nbsp;authorize one or more of its members or an agent to execute or deliver any instrument, and make any payment
on its behalf, and (b)&nbsp;utilize the services of associates and engage accountants, agents, legal counsel, record keepers, professional consultants (any of whom may also be serving the Company) or authorized Company personnel to assist in the
administration of this Plan or to render advice with regard to any responsibility or issue arising under this Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.06</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Records and Reports of the Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall maintain records and accounts relating to the administration of this Plan. An Executive shall be entitled to review any records relating to his
or her individual participation in this Plan and to make copies of such records upon written request to the Committee.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.07</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Liability of the Committee; Indemnification.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The members of the Committee and the Plan Administrator shall have no liability with respect to any action or omission made by them in good faith nor from any
action or omission made in reliance upon (a)&nbsp;the advice or opinion of any accountant, legal counsel, medical adviser or other professional consultant or (b)&nbsp;any resolutions of the Committee or the Board certified by the Secretary or
Assistant Secretary of the Company. Each member of the Committee and the Plan Administrator shall be indemnified, defended and held harmless by the Company and its respective successors against all claims, liabilities, fines and penalties and all
expenses (including without limitation reasonable attorneys' fees and disbursements and other professional costs incurred in enforcing this provision) reasonably incurred by or imposed upon such individual which arise as a result of his or her
actions or failure to act in connection with the operation and administration of this Plan, to the extent lawfully allowable and to the extent that such claim, liability, fine, penalty or expense is not paid for by liability insurance purchased by or
paid for by the Company or an affiliate thereof. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company shall not indemnify any person for any such amount incurred through any settlement or compromise of any action unless the Company consents in writing to such
settlement or compromise, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.08</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Plan Expenses.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All expenses under or relating to this Plan shall be paid from the general assets of the Company. To the extent required by applicable law, the Company may require any member of the
Committee to furnish a fidelity bond satisfactory to the Company.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.09</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Service in More than One Capacity.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any person or group of persons may serve this Plan in more than one capacity.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.10</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Named Fiduciary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The named fiduciary of this Plan shall be the Committee.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.11</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Delegation of Responsibility.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall have the authority to delegate from time to time, in writing, all or any part of its responsibilities under this Plan to one or more members of the
Committee. The Committee may also delegate administrative functions to the Plan Administrator pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.02 above. The Committee may in the same manner revise or revoke any such delegation of responsibility. Any action of the delegate
in the exercise of such delegated responsibilities shall have the same force and effect for all purposes hereunder as if such action had been taken by the Committee. The Committee shall not be liable for any acts or omissions of any such delegate.
The delegate shall periodically report to the Committee concerning the discharge of the delegated responsibilities.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.12</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Filing a Claim.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Each individual eligible for benefits under this Plan ("Claimant") may submit a claim for benefits ("Claim") to the Plan Administrator in writing on a form provided or approved by the Plan Administrator or, if no such form has been so provided or
approved, in a written document that specifies, in reasonable detail, facts and circumstances and the applicable Plan provisions which the Claimant believes entitle him or her to compensation or benefits under this Plan. A Claimant shall have no
right to seek review of a denial of benefits, or to bring any action in any court to enforce a Claim, prior to his or her filing a Claim and exhausting his or her rights to review under this Article&nbsp;2.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
When a Claim has been filed properly, it shall be evaluated and the Claimant shall be notified of the approval or the denial of the Claim within 45&nbsp;days after the receipt of such Claim unless special circumstances require an extension of time
for processing the Claim. If such an extension is required, written notice of the extension shall be furnished to the Claimant prior to the end of the initial 45-day period, which notice shall specify the special circumstances requiring an extension
and the date by which a final decision will be reached (which date shall not be later than 90&nbsp;days after the date on which the Claim was filed). A Claimant shall be given a written notice in which the</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- insert table folio -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>49</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=440111,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KE1918A.;13',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;11:02' -->
<A NAME="page_ke1918_1_50"> </A>
<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Claimant shall be advised as to whether the Claim is granted or denied, in whole or in part. If a Claim is denied, in whole or in part, the notice shall contain (i)&nbsp;the specific reasons for the denial, (ii)&nbsp;references to pertinent Plan
provisions upon which the denial is based, (iii)&nbsp;a description of any additional material or information necessary to perfect the Claim and an explanation of why such material or information is necessary, and (iv)&nbsp;the Claimant's right to
seek review of the denial.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
An election to become a Transition Officer pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.01 shall not be considered a Claim and shall not be subject to this Section&nbsp;2.12.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
2.13</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Review of Claim Denial.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;If a Claim is denied, in whole or in part, the Claimant shall have the right to (i)&nbsp;request a review of the denial by the Committee or its delegate, (ii)&nbsp;review
pertinent documents, (iii)&nbsp;submit issues and comments in writing to the Committee and (iv)&nbsp;appear before the Committee in person to present such issues and comments; provided that the Claimant files a written request for review with the
Committee within 60&nbsp;days after the Claimant's receipt of written notice of the denial. Within 60&nbsp;days after the Committee receives a request for review, the review shall be made and the Claimant shall be advised in writing of the decision
on review, unless special circumstances require an extension of time for such review, in which case the Claimant shall be given a written notice within such initial 60-day period specifying the reasons for the extension and when such review shall be
completed; provided that such review shall be completed within 120&nbsp;days after the filing of the request for review. The Committee's decision on review shall be sent to the Claimant in writing and shall include (i)&nbsp;specific reasons for the
decision and (ii)&nbsp;references to Plan provisions upon which the decision is based. A decision on review shall be binding on all persons for all purposes.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a Claimant shall fail to file a request for review in accordance with the procedures herein outlined, such Claimant shall have no right to obtain such a review or to bring an action in any court, and
the denial of the Claim shall become final and binding on all persons for all purposes except upon a showing of good cause for such failure.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
ARTICLE&nbsp;3. RETENTION PERIOD</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=4 VALIGN="TOP"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
During an Executive's Retention Period (as defined in the next sentence), the Executive shall remain employed by the Company as an officer, on an at-will basis. Each Executive's "Retention Period" shall mean the period commencing on the Executive's
Plan Start Date and ending on the later of the Executive's End Date (as specified on Appendix&nbsp;A) or the day before the Executive's Change-in-Status Date (as determined pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.01 below).</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=4><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
ARTICLE&nbsp;4. TRANSITION PERIOD</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
4.01</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Election to Become a Transition Officer.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Transition Officer.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the conditions set forth below, each Executive may elect to become a "Transition Officer" entitled to the benefits provided to Transition Officers hereunder (the
"Transition Benefits"), effective on a date (hereinafter referred to as the Executive's "Change-in-Status Date") not earlier than the day after the Executive's End Date.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Conditions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The conditions that must be satisfied in order for an Executive's election to become a Transition Officer to be effective are as follows: (i)&nbsp;the Executive must remain employed by the
Company through the end of his or her Retention Period; (ii)&nbsp;the Executive must properly execute a Transition Period Agreement not later than the Change-in-Status Date; (iii)&nbsp;the Executive must not revoke such Transition Period Agreement;
(iv)&nbsp;in the case of a Tier&nbsp;II Executive or a Tier&nbsp;III Executive whose Change-in-Status Date occurs before his or her 62nd birthday, a successor to the Executive must have been selected by the Company and approved by the Chief Executive
Officer of the Company (the "CEO") in the CEO's sole discretion; and (v)&nbsp;in the case of an Executive whose Change-in-Status Date occurs before his or her 62nd birthday, the Committee or the CEO, as applicable, must consent to the Executive's
becoming a Transition Officer, in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.01(c) below.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Election.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Executive shall make an election to become a Transition Officer by delivering to the Committee (in the case of an election by the CEO) or to the CEO (in the case of an election by any other
Executive) a written notice indicating the proposed Change-in-Status Date, on such form as the Committee may from time to time prescribe. If the proposed Change-in-Status Date occurs before the Executive's 62nd birthday, the Committee or the CEO, as
applicable, shall notify the Executive whether such election is accepted. If the proposed Change-in-Status Date occurs on or after the Executive's 62nd birthday, such election shall automatically be deemed accepted. If such election is accepted or
deemed accepted, the Committee or the CEO, as applicable, shall also (1)&nbsp;notify the Executive whether the actual Change-in-Status Date will be the date proposed by the Executive or a later or earlier date reasonably selected by the Committee or
the CEO, as applicable (but in no event earlier than the Executive's End Date), and (2)&nbsp;enclose with such notice the Transition Period Agreement for execution by the Executive.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- insert table folio -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>50</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=1037683,FOLIO='50',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KE1918B.;5',USER='JDARCHE',CD='12-MAR-2003;11:02' -->
<A NAME="page_ke1918_1_51"> </A>
<!-- end of table folio -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Transition Period.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If an Executive properly executes and returns the Transition Period Agreement, does not revoke the Transition Period Agreement and satisfies the other conditions set forth above, his
or her election to become a Transition Officer shall become effective upon the applicable Change-in-Status Date, and the Executive shall thereafter serve as a Transition Officer during a number of months (the "Transition Period") equal to the lesser
of (i)&nbsp;the number of the Executive's Years of Service (as defined below), or (ii)&nbsp;18&nbsp;months, subject to the provisions of this Plan. An Executive's "Years of Service" shall equal the number of 12-month intervals during the period
beginning on the earlier of the Executive's historical service date or company service date and ending on the Change-in-Status Date, rounded down to the nearest complete 12-month interval (e.g., a period of 128&nbsp;months and 3&nbsp;days shall equal
10 "Years of Service").</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
4.02</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Transition Benefits.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Base Salary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During an Executive's Transition Period, the Company shall pay the Executive a base salary at the annualized rate in effect on the day immediately preceding the Change-in-Status Date, but in
no event lower than the highest base salary in effect at any time between the Executive's Plan Start Date and Change-in-Status Date, provided that the base salary payable under this Section&nbsp;4.02(a) shall be reduced in accordance with any
across-the-board reductions approved by the Committee prior to the Change-in-Status Date, which reductions affect Company officers generally. (The annualized amount of such base salary as in effect from time to time is referred to as the "Annual Base
Salary.") In no event shall an Executive be eligible for merit increases in base salary during his or her Transition Period.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Annual Bonus.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In respect of each calendar year which ends during or on the last day of an Executive's Transition Period, the Company shall pay to the Executive an Annual Bonus (as defined below) in a
lump sum on April&nbsp;1st of the following year (or such other date on which bonuses for such year are paid to participants in the Company's Target Incentive Program or any successor plan ("TIP") generally). If the Transition Period ends on a date
other than the last day of a calendar year, the Company shall pay to the Executive (in lieu of an Annual Bonus) a Prorated Annual Bonus (as defined below) in a lump sum in cash within 60&nbsp;days after the end of the Transition Period. The Executive
shall not be entitled to elect to defer any portion of the Prorated Annual Bonus under any Deferred Compensation Plan.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
For purposes of this Plan,</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
"Annual Bonus" shall mean an annual bonus equal to the product of the Annual Base Salary and the Full Target Percentage (as defined below);</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
"Full Target Percentage" shall mean the target percentage which the Executive was eligible to receive under TIP on the day immediately preceding the Change-in-Status Date without any adjustment, but in no event lower than the Executive's highest
target percentage in effect at any time between the Executive's Plan Start Date and Change-in-Status Date, provided that the target percentage shall be reduced in accordance with any across-the-board reductions approved by the Committee prior to the
Change-in-Status Date which reductions affect Company officers generally; and</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(iii)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
"Prorated Annual Bonus" shall mean a bonus in an amount equal to the Annual Bonus multiplied by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days which have elapsed during the calendar year in question through the last day of the Transition
Period, and the denominator of which is 365.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Three-Year Incentive Plan Awards.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During an Executive's Transition Period, any outstanding awards that the Executive has been granted under the Company's Three-Year Incentive Plan or any successor plan
("LTIP") shall continue to vest and become payable in accordance with the Company's policies as in effect from time to time; provided, that such LTIP awards ("LTIP Awards") shall be computed by reference to 100% of the target percentage the Executive
would have received pursuant to the terms of the original LTIP grant without any adjustment; and provided, further, that in the case of a Tier&nbsp;III Executive, such an LTIP Award shall not be paid unless the minimum corporate performance
thresholds for the applicable performance period are met.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><I><BR>
Benefit Programs and Policies.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During an Executive's Transition Period, he or she shall participate in Employee Plans and Compensation Plans as provided in Section&nbsp;1.02(d) above, except that:
(i)&nbsp;the Executive shall not be eligible to participate in TIP except to the extent and on the terms provided for above in this Section&nbsp;4.02; (ii)&nbsp;no new stock option grants shall be made to the Executive; (iii)&nbsp;no new awards shall
be granted to the Executive under LTIP; (iv)&nbsp;no other new awards shall be granted to the Executive under any Compensation Plans; (v)&nbsp;the Executive shall not be entitled to participate in any other Compensation Plans; and (vi)&nbsp;the
effect of the Executive's entering the Transition Period for any incentive awards that the Executive holds immediately before his or her Change in Status Date that are not specifically provided for above shall be as provided in the applicable plans
and/or agreements.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><BR><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="87%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
