<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=13,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=911589,FOLIO='59',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KK1918A.;11',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_km1918_1_60"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A. Transition Period Agreement  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>THIS
TRANSITION PERIOD AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into as of this&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;day
of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, by and between McDonald's Corporation, a Delaware corporation
(the
"Company") and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(the "Executive"), pursuant to the Company's Executive Retention Plan (the
"Plan"), a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WITNESSETH:
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
the Executive is a Tier&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Executive under the Plan; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
if the Executive complies with his/her obligations under the Plan, he/she will hereafter be entitled to substantial compensation and benefits under the Plan to which he/she would not
otherwise be entitled; and </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
the Executive is required under the Plan to execute this Agreement; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as
follows: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capitalized terms used but not defined in this Agreement shall have the meanings given to them in the Plan. The
following terms shall have the meanings set forth below: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Company Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all records, documents, materials, papers, computer records or print-outs belonging to McDonald's, including without limitation those
containing Confidential Information and Trade Secrets. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Competing Business.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any Person (and any branches, offices or operations thereof) that is a material and direct competitor of McDonald's in any country in the world
or in any state of the United States by virtue of selling, manufacturing, processing or promoting any product that is substantially similar to, competes with, or is intended to compete with, replace,
or duplicate in the market any product that was sold or under development by McDonald's during the five years (or shorter period of the Executive's employment with the Company) preceding the date of
execution of this Agreement or with respect to which the Executive has had specific knowledge and involvement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Confidential Information and Trade Secrets.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all valuable and unique tangible and intangible information and techniques acquired, developed or used by McDonald's
relating to its business, operations, employees and customers, which gives McDonald's a competitive advantage in the businesses in which McDonald's is engaged, including without limitation processes,
methods, techniques, systems, computer data, formulae, patents, models, devices, compilations, customer lists, supplier lists or any information of whatever nature that gives McDonald's an opportunity
to obtain an advantage over competitors who do not know or use such data or information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Executive.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> HR Official.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Company's Senior Executive Vice President of Human Resources (or any successor position). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> McDonald's.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Company and its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates and related companies. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> McDonald's-Related Person.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any director, officer, employee or franchisee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates and related companies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Other Separation Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;9(c) below. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Person.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a person, firm, corporation, partnership, venture or other entity of any kind. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Recovery Period.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;10(c)(iii) below. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Release Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Executive's Change-in-Status Date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Released Persons.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;9(a) below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Specified Competitors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the entities listed on Exhibit&nbsp;B hereto and their respective subsidiaries and affiliates, as required by Section&nbsp;1.02(b) of the
Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Stock Option Gains.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;10(c)(iv) below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Violation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;8(a) below. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>60</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=14,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=819946,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KM1918A.;13',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_km1918_1_61"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Relationship of Agreement to Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive hereby agrees to be bound by the terms of the Plan, and to fulfill all of
his/her obligations under the Plan, including without limitation to render services as set forth in the Plan and to execute additional Agreement(s) as and when required by the Plan. The provisions of
the Plan, including without limitation the provision regarding administration in Article&nbsp;2 of the Plan, are applicable to this Agreement and to the obligations of the Company and the Executive
hereunder, and are hereby incorporated by reference into this Agreement. However, any amendments made to the Plan after the date of this Agreement will not apply to the Executive.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Circumstances Requiring Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive has given notice pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.01 of the Plan of his/her
election to become a Transition Officer[, and the [CEO]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(1)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
[Committee]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(2)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> has consented to such
election]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(3)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Accordingly, the Executive's Change-in-Status Date shall
be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and the Executive's Transition Period shall be the period from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. This Agreement constitutes the
Executive's Transition
Period Agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Compensation and Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Executive's Transition Period, the Executive shall receive the compensation and
benefits provided for in Article&nbsp;4 of the Plan, subject to the Executive's compliance with the requirements of the Plan and this Agreement. In addition, if the Executive remains employed
through the end of the Transition Period and otherwise complies with the requirements of the Plan and this Agreement, including without limitation executing and not revoking a Continued Employment
Period Agreement, the Executive shall receive the compensation and benefits provided for in Article&nbsp;5 of the Plan during his/her Continued Employment Period. Finally, upon the termination of
the Executive's employment, he/she shall receive the compensation and benefits (if any) provided for in such circumstances under Article&nbsp;7 of the Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Company Property and Confidentiality.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges that (i)&nbsp;it is the policy of McDonald's to maintain as secret and
confidential all Confidential Information and Trade Secrets; (ii)&nbsp;all Confidential Information and Trade Secrets are the sole and exclusive property of McDonald's; and (iii)&nbsp;disclosure
of Confidential Information and Trade Secrets would cause significant damage to McDonald's.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Company Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive agrees to turn all Company Property over to the CEO or the CEO's designee, at or as promptly
as practicable following the execution of this Agreement, except for Company Property that is necessary to perform his or her assigned functions during the Transition Period or the Continued
Employment Period. The Executive also agrees to turn any Company Property that the Executive retains after the date of this Agreement pursuant to the preceding sentence over to the CEO or the CEO's
designee as soon as it is no longer necessary for the Executive to retain such Company Property in order to perform such assigned functions, and in any event not later than the last day of the
Executive's employment with the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Confidentiality.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, without obtaining the Company's consent pursuant to Section&nbsp;7 below, use,
disclose, furnish or make accessible to any Person any Confidential Information and Trade Secrets obtained during the Executive's employment with the Company at any time (including, without
limitation, during or after the Retention Period, the Transition Period or the Continued Employment Period) for so long as such information remains confidential or secret, except as required by the
duties of the Executive's employment with the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Covenants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges that McDonald's is engaged in a highly competitive, global business that
requires the preservation of Confidential Information and Trade Secrets. The Executive further acknowledges that McDonald's has near-permanent relationships with vendors, affiliates,
customers, suppliers, manufacturers, alliance partners, employees and service organizations, which McDonald's has a legitimate interest in protecting. Finally, the Executive acknowledges that the
covenants set forth in this Section&nbsp;6 are reasonable under the circumstances, that he or she has the skill and ability to find alternative commensurate work not in violation of such covenants
and the Executive has the wherewithal to support himself/herself and his/her family without violating such covenants, including without limitation the covenant not to compete provided for in
Section&nbsp;6(b) below. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> For Agreements other than with the CEO.  </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> For Agreements with the CEO.  </I></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(3)
</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> Include only if the Change-in-Status Date is before the Executive's sixty-second birthday.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>61</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=15,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=73751,FOLIO='61',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KM1918A.;13',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_km1918_1_62"> </A>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Noncompetition.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive agrees to not work for or provide services to a Competing Business or to the Specified
Competitors during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that follows the date of execution of the Agreement and for two years following any termination of the Executive's employment.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Covenants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the Executive shall not, at any time during the Executive's employment with the Company: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Promote,
sell or create any product sold by a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Provide
marketing services, consultation or services to enhance the sales of a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Use
the McDonald's name or any other brand name of McDonald's, or the fact of the Executive's affiliation or former affiliation with McDonald's, in
any manner that aids or benefits, or is intended to aid or benefit, a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exceptions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It shall not be considered a violation of this Section&nbsp;6 for the Executive to engage in any of the
following:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
performance of services for and on behalf of an investment banking or commercial banking, auditing or consulting firm during the Continued
Employment Period or at any time after the termination of the Executive's employment, so long as the Executive is not personally engaged in rendering services to or soliciting business of a Competing
Business or any of the Specified Competitors; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Being
the record or beneficial owner of up to one (1)&nbsp;percent of the outstanding voting securities of any publicly traded entity, provided that
such investment does not create a conflict of interest between the Executive's duties hereunder and the Executive's interest in such investment or otherwise violate the Company's rules and policies
(including without limitation the Standards of Business Conduct). </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Solicitation or Hiring of Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that
follows the date of execution of the Agreement and for two years following any termination of the Executive's employment, solicit or attempt to solicit any employee (other than the Executive's
administrative assistant), consultant, franchisee, supplier or independent contractor of McDonald's to terminate, alter, or lessen that party's affiliation with McDonald's or to interfere with or
violate the terms of any agreement or understanding between such entity, employee or person and McDonald's.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Disparagement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that follows the date of
execution of the Agreement and for three years following any termination of the Executive's employment, (i)&nbsp;make any public disclosures or publish any articles or books about McDonald's, its
business or any McDonald'sRelated Person, or grant an interview to any representative of the public media, without the prior written consent of the CEO, or (ii) intentionally publish any statement or
make any disclosure about McDonald's, its business or any McDonald's-Related Person that is disparaging, derogatory or otherwise casts a bad light on McDonald's, its business or any McDonald's-Related
Person. </FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Consent Procedure.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Seeking Consent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive may seek the Company's consent to engage in any of the activities prohibited by
Section&nbsp;6 above, by providing written notice thereof to the Company addressed to the HR Official [or to the
CEO]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(4)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, including a full and complete disclosure in writing to the Company of all the relevant facts, including without
limitation the services to be rendered or activities to be engaged in, places of employment, performance of services or activities, compensation to be paid, expertise to be provided, amount to be
invested, stock or debt to be received, and business plan or plans to be executed by such entity or person. The Company thereafter shall have fourteen (14)&nbsp;calendar days to consider the
Executive's contemplated activities as disclosed and shall in writing, either consent or object to such activities. It is agreed that consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Binding Decisions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All decisions of the Company under this Section&nbsp;7 shall be final and binding upon the Executive,
and the Executive shall not engage in any such activities if the Company shall object. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(4)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> Do not include in an Agreement signed by the CEO.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>62</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=16,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=931089,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KM1918A.;13',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_km1918_1_63"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Legal Compulsion.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Notice.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Executive reasonably and in good faith believes that he or she is or may be compelled by law or by a court or
governmental agency by a proper proceeding to disclose Confidential Information and Trade Secrets, or to make a statement or take other action that would, absent this Section&nbsp;8, violate
Section&nbsp;6(f) above (each such disclosure, statement or action, a "Violation"), then the Executive shall give the Company written notice thereof as far in advance of such Violation as is lawful
and practicable, shall cooperate (at the Company's sole expense) with the Company in its efforts to prevent such Violation from being compelled, and shall limit his or her Violation to the minimum
compelled by law or court order, except to the extent the Company agrees otherwise in writing.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Violation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Executive complies with the foregoing procedure to the greatest extent possible without violating
applicable law, then the Executive shall not be deemed to have breached Section&nbsp;5(c) or 6(f) above, as applicable, as a result of the Violation. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Release Provisions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the entire period of the Executive's employment by the Company, including his Retention Period, up to
the Release Date: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Release.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive understands, intends and agrees that this Section&nbsp;9 constitutes full, complete and final
satisfaction of all claims, demands, lawsuits or actions of any kind, whether known or unknown, against McDonald's and/or their respective directors, officers or employees (with McDonald's,
collectively, the "Released Persons"), arising at any time up to and including the Release Date, and the Executive hereby forever releases each Released Person from all such matters. This includes,
but is not limited to, a release of claims, demands, lawsuits and actions of any kind relating to any employment or application for employment or franchise, claims relating to resignation and/or
cessation of employment, claims alleging breach of contract of any tort, claims for wrongful termination, defamation, intentional infliction of emotional distress, personal injury, violation of public
policy and/or negligence related to employment or resignation, claims under Title&nbsp;VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended, Section&nbsp;1981 of the Civil Rights Act of 1866, as
amended, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, as amended, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974,
as amended, the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act, the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993, the Illinois Human Rights Act, or any other state, Federal or local law prohibiting
discrimination, and claims based on any other law, regulation, or common law, whether before any Federal, state or local agency, in any court of law or before any other forum. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, the Executive's release shall not extend to any claims (i)&nbsp;for benefits under Employee Plans that are qualified under Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code,
(ii)&nbsp;for compensation or benefits to which the Executive is entitled under the Plan as provided in Section&nbsp;4 above, (iii)&nbsp;for compensation or benefits under any Employee Plan or
Compensation Plan to which the Executive is entitled by the terms thereof, except as provided otherwise in Section&nbsp;9(c) below and except to the extent such entitlements are specifically amended
or eliminated by the Plan, or (iv)&nbsp;for indemnification under the Company's policy on indemnification of officers and directors and coverage under any related insurance policies.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Advice, Time to Consider and Revocation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[The Executive is hereby advised to consult with an attorney prior to
executing this Agreement. The Executive is further advised that he/she has a period of 21&nbsp;days within which to consider the terms of this Agreement and whether or not to execute it. In
addition, for a period of 7&nbsp;days following the Executive's execution of this Agreement, he/she has the right to revoke this Agreement, and no portion of this Agreement shall become effective or
enforceable until such revocation period has expired.]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(5)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges and agrees that the payments and benefits provided to the Executive under the
Plan are in lieu of any payments, benefits or arrangements to which the Executive might otherwise be entitled to under any Employee Plan or other plan or arrangement which provides for severance or
separation ("Other Separation Benefits"), and the Executive hereby waives any and all rights and claims that he or she may now or hereafter have to any Other Separation Benefits; provided, that the
foregoing waiver shall not apply to any right the Executive may have to any gross-up payments related to the excise tax on excess parachute payments imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the
Internal Revenue Code under any change of control employment agreement with the Company. The foregoing shall not be construed as affecting in any manner the Executive's benefits and entitlements (if
any) under any Employee Plan that provides pension or retiree medical or life insurance benefits. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(5)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> This language may be deleted or modified by the Company, depending upon individual circumstances and/or changes in law relating to age discrimination or
otherwise.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>63</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=17,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=729157,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KM1918A.;13',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_km1918_1_64"> </A>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges having read and understood the provisions of this Section&nbsp;9 as well as
the other provisions of this Agreement, and represents that his/her execution of this Agreement constitutes his/her knowing and voluntary act, made without coercion or intimidation. The Executive
acknowledges and agrees that the release set forth in this Section&nbsp;9 is being given only in exchange for consideration in addition to anything of value to which the Executive already is
entitled. The Executive finally agrees not to file any lawsuits against the Company or any of the released entities or persons with respect to claims covered by the release given in this
Section&nbsp;9. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>10.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Remedies.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In recognition of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information and Trade Secrets, and in
recognition of the necessity of the limited restrictions imposed by the Agreement, the Executive acknowledges it would be impossible to measure solely in money the damages which McDonald's would
suffer if the Executive were to breach any of his/her obligations under Sections&nbsp;5 and 6 above. The Executive also acknowledges that his/her breach of any such obligations would irreparably
injure the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Entitlement to Injunctive Relief</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. If the Executive breaches any of his/her obligations under Sections&nbsp;5 and 6 above, McDonald's
shall be entitled, in addition to any other remedies to which McDonald's may be entitled under the Agreement or otherwise, to an injunction issued by a court of competent jurisdiction, to restrain any
breach or threatened breach, of such provisions, and the Executive waives any right to assert any claim or defense that McDonald's has an adequate remedy at law for any such breach and any right to
require, or request a court to require, that McDonald's post a bond in connection therewith.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effect on Other Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a breach by the Executive of any of his/her obligations under this Agreement,
excluding for this purpose an isolated, insubstantial and inadvertent action, the Company shall be entitled to: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>discontinue
any and all payments and other benefits to which the Executive or his/her beneficiaries would otherwise be entitled pursuant to this
Agreement and/or the Plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>terminate
any and all unexercised stock options then held by the Executive or by any transferee of the Executive;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
the case of any such breach occurring after the Executive's Change-in-Status Date, require the Executive to repay to the
Company the aggregate amount of cash payments received by the Executive from the Company pursuant to this Agreement and/or the Plan during the period commencing on the Executive's
Change-in-Status Date and ending on the date on which the Company requests such repayment (the "Recovery Period"); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
the case of any such breach occurring after the Executive's Change-in-Status Date, require the Executive to pay to the
Company any Stock Option Gains (as defined in the next two sentences). "Stock Option Gains" with respect to the Executive's stock options that were not vested as of his or her
Change-in-Status Date means the aggregate amount of any gain recognized upon exercise of such stock options during the Recovery Period. "Stock Option Gains" with respect to the
Executive's stock options that were vested as of his or her Change-in-Status Date means the excess, if any, of (A)&nbsp;the aggregate amount of any gain recognized upon
exercise of such stock options during the Recovery Period, over (B)&nbsp;the amount of gain that would have been recognized, had such exercises instead occurred on the Executive's
Change-in-Status Date. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>11.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Successors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Company and the Executive and their
respective heirs, representatives and successors.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>12.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Jurisdiction and Venue.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any action arising under this Agreement or between the Company and the Executive shall be instituted
and brought exclusively under the jurisdiction and venue of the appropriate state or federal courts for the City of Oak Brook, Illinois, County of DuPage. The Executive hereby consents to the
exclusive jurisdiction of said courts regardless of where the Executive may be domiciled at the time such suit is brought. It is further agreed that in the event the Company shall be required to
institute any proceedings to enforce the terms of this Agreement, then the Company shall be entitled to recover its attorney fees and attendant expenses as part of any recovery. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>64</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=18,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=737323,FOLIO='64',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KM1918A.;13',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_km1918_1_65"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>13.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Captions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The captions of the Sections of and Exhibits to this Agreement are not a part of the provisions hereof and shall
have no force or effect.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>14.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Entire Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement, together with the Plan, contain the entire agreement between the parties, and supersede
any and all previous agreements, written or oral, between the Executive and the Company relating to the subject matter hereof. No amendment or modification of the terms of this Agreement shall be
binding upon the parties hereto unless reduced to writing and signed by each of the parties hereto.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>15.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>16.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Severability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any one or more Sections or other portions of this Agreement are declared by any court or governmental
authority to be unlawful or invalid, such unlawfulness or invalidity shall not serve to invalidate any Section or other portion not so declared to be unlawful or invalid. Any Section or other portion
so declared to be unlawful or invalid shall be construed so as to effectuate the terms of such Section or other portion to the fullest extent possible while remaining lawful and valid.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>17.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent not preempted by federal law, this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in accordance
with the laws of the State of Illinois, without regard to any otherwise applicable conflicts of law or choice of law principles. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Executive has hereunto set his hand, and the Company has caused these presents to be executed in its name on its behalf, all as of the day and year first above written. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A

EXHIBIT&nbsp;A. EXECUTIVE RETENTION PLAN </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>[Attach]
</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>66</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=20,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=868265,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KO1918A.;4',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_ko1918_1_67"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>EXHIBIT&nbsp;B.
SPECIFIED COMPETITORS </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>[List
of 25 to be inserted upon preparation of specific Agreement] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>67</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=21,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=111572,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KO1918A.;4',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_kq1918_1_68"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;B. Continued Employment Period Agreement  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>THIS
CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT PERIOD AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into as of this&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;day
of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, by and between McDonald's Corporation, a Delaware
corporation (the "Company") and&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(the "Executive"), pursuant to the Company's Executive
Retention Plan (the "Plan"), a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit&nbsp;A. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WITNESSETH:
</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
the Executive is a Tier&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Executive under the Plan; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
if the Executive complies with his/her obligations under the Plan, he/she will hereafter be entitled to substantial compensation and benefits under the Plan to which he/she would not
otherwise be entitled; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
during the Executive's Transition Period, the Executive has received substantial compensation and benefits under the Plan to which he/she would not otherwise have been entitled; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>WHEREAS,
the Executive is required under the Plan to execute this Agreement; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the parties agree as
follows: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capitalized terms used but not defined in this Agreement shall have the meanings given to them in the Plan. The
following terms shall have the meanings set forth below: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Company Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all records, documents, materials, papers, computer records or print-outs belonging to McDonald's, including without limitation those
containing Confidential Information and Trade Secrets. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Competing Business.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any Person (and any branches, offices or operations thereof) that is a material and direct competitor of McDonald's in any country in the world
or in any state of the United States by virtue of selling, manufacturing, processing or promoting any product that is substantially similar to, competes with, or is intended to compete with, replace,
or duplicate in the market any product that was sold or under development by McDonald's during the five years (or shorter period of the Executive's employment with the Company) preceding the date of
execution of this Agreement or with respect to which the Executive has had specific knowledge and involvement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Confidential Information and Trade Secrets.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;all valuable and unique tangible and intangible information and techniques acquired, developed or used by McDonald's
relating to its business, operations, employees and customers, which gives McDonald's a competitive advantage in the businesses in which McDonald's is engaged, including without limitation processes,
methods, techniques, systems, computer data, formulae, patents, models, devices, compilations, customer lists, supplier lists or any information of whatever nature that gives McDonald's an opportunity
to obtain an advantage over competitors who do not know or use such data or information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Executive.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> HR Official.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Company's Senior Executive Vice President of Human Resources (or any successor position). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> McDonald's.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the Company and its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates and related companies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> McDonald's-Related Person.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;any director, officer, employee or franchisee of the Company or any of its subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates and related companies. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Other Separation Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;9(c) below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Person.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a person, firm, corporation, partnership, venture or other entity of any kind. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in the first paragraph above. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Recovery Period.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;10(c)(iii) below. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Release Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the last day of the Executive's Transition Period. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Released Persons.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;9(a) below. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Specified Competitors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the entities listed on Exhibit&nbsp;B hereto and their respective subsidiaries and affiliates, as required by Section&nbsp;1.02(b) of the
Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Stock Option Gains.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;10(c)(iv) below. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I> Violation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;8(a) below. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>68</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=22,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=435643,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KQ1918A.;7',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_kq1918_1_69"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Relationship of Agreement to Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive hereby agrees to be bound by the terms of the Plan, and to fulfill all of
his/her obligations under the Plan, including without limitation to render services as set forth in the Plan and to execute additional Agreement(s) as and when required by the Plan. The provisions of
the Plan, including without limitation the provision regarding administration in Article&nbsp;2 of the Plan, are applicable to this Agreement and to the obligations of the Company and the Executive
hereunder, and are hereby incorporated by reference into this Agreement. However, any amendments made to the Plan after the date of this Agreement will not apply to the Executive.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Circumstances Requiring Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive's Continued Employment Period shall be the period
from&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. This Agreement constitutes the Executive's Continued Employment Period Agreement.

<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Compensation and Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the Executive's Continued Employment Period, the Executive shall receive the compensation
and benefits provided for in Article&nbsp;5 of the Plan, subject to the Executive's compliance with the requirements of the Plan and this Agreement. In addition, upon the termination of the
Executive's employment, he/she shall receive the compensation and benefits (if any) provided for in such circumstances under Article&nbsp;7 of the Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Company Property and Confidentiality.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges that (i)&nbsp;it is the policy of McDonald's to maintain as secret and
confidential all Confidential Information and Trade Secrets; (ii)&nbsp;all Confidential Information and Trade Secrets are the sole and exclusive property of McDonald's; and (iii)&nbsp;disclosure
of Confidential Information and Trade Secrets would cause significant damage to McDonald's.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Company Property.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive agrees to turn all Company Property over to the CEO or the CEO's designee, at or as promptly
as practicable following the execution of this Agreement, except for Company Property that is necessary to perform his or her assigned functions during the Continued Employment Period. The Executive
also agrees to turn any Company Property that the Executive retains after the date of this Agreement pursuant to the preceding sentence over to the CEO or the CEO's designee as soon as it is no longer
necessary for the Executive to retain such Company Property in order to perform such assigned functions, and in any event not later than the last day of the Executive's employment with the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Confidentiality.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, without obtaining the Company's consent pursuant to Section&nbsp;7 below, use,
disclose, furnish or make accessible to any Person any Confidential Information and Trade Secrets obtained during the Executive's employment with the Company at any time (including, without
limitation, during or after the Retention Period, the Transition Period or the Continued Employment Period) for so long as such information remains confidential or secret, except as required by the
duties of the Executive's employment with the Company. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Covenants.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges that McDonald's is engaged in a highly competitive, global business that
requires the preservation of Confidential Information and Trade Secrets. The Executive further acknowledges that McDonald's has near-permanent relationships with vendors, affiliates,
customers, suppliers, manufacturers, alliance partners, employees and service organizations, which McDonald's has a legitimate interest in protecting. Finally, the Executive acknowledges that the
covenants set forth in this Section&nbsp;6 are reasonable under the circumstances, that he or she has the skill and ability to find alternative commensurate work not in violation of such covenants
and the Executive has the wherewithal to support himself/herself and his/her family without violating such covenants, including without limitation the covenant not to compete provided for in
Section&nbsp;6(b) below.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Noncompetition.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive agrees to not work for or provide services to a Competing Business or to the Specified
Competitors during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that follows the date of execution of the Agreement and for two years following any termination of the Executive's employment. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>69</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=23,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=59055,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KQ1918A.;7',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_kq1918_1_70"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Covenants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, the Executive shall not, at any time during the Executive's employment with the Company: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Promote,
sell or create any product sold by a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Provide
marketing services, consultation or services to enhance the sales of a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor; or
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Use
the McDonald's name or any other brand name of McDonald's, or the fact of the Executive's affiliation or former affiliation with McDonald's, in
any manner that aids or benefits, or is intended to aid or benefit, a Competing Business or a Specified Competitor. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exceptions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It shall not be considered a violation of this Section&nbsp;6 for the Executive to engage in any of the
following: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
performance of services for and on behalf of an investment banking or commercial banking, auditing or consulting firm during the Continued
Employment Period or at any time after the termination of the Executive's employment, so long as the Executive is not personally engaged in rendering services to or soliciting business of a Competing
Business or any of the Specified Competitors; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Being
the record or beneficial owner of up to one (1)&nbsp;percent of the outstanding voting securities of any publicly traded entity, provided that
such investment does not create a conflict of interest between the Executive's duties hereunder and the Executive's interest in such investment or otherwise violate the Company's rules and policies
(including without limitation the Standards of Business Conduct). </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Solicitation or Hiring of Employees.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that
follows the date of execution of the Agreement and for two years following any termination of the Executive's employment, solicit or attempt to solicit any employee (other than the Executive's
administrative assistant), consultant, franchisee, supplier or independent contractor of McDonald's to terminate, alter, or lessen that party's affiliation with McDonald's or to interfere with or
violate the terms of any agreement or understanding between such entity, employee or person and McDonald's.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Disparagement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive shall not, during the portion of his/her Employment Periods that follows the date of
execution of the Agreement and for three years following any termination of the Executive's employment, (i)&nbsp;make any public disclosures or publish any articles or books about McDonald's, its
business or any McDonald'sRelated Person, or grant an interview to any representative of the public media, without the prior written consent of the CEO, or (ii)&nbsp;intentionally publish any
statement or make any disclosure about McDonald's, its business or any McDonald's-Related Person that is disparaging, derogatory or otherwise casts a bad light on McDonald's, its business or any
McDonald's-Related Person. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Consent
Procedure. </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Seeking Consent.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive may seek the Company's consent to engage in any of the activities prohibited by
Section&nbsp;6 above, by providing written notice thereof to the Company addressed to the HR Official [or to the
CEO]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(1)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, including a full and complete disclosure in writing to the Company of all the relevant facts, including without
limitation the services to be rendered or activities to be engaged in, places of employment, performance of services or activities, compensation to be paid, expertise to be provided, amount to be
invested, stock or debt to be received, and business plan or plans to be executed by such entity or person. The Company thereafter shall have fourteen (14)&nbsp;calendar days to consider the
Executive's contemplated activities as disclosed and shall in writing, either consent or object to such activities. It is agreed that consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Binding Decisions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All decisions of the Company under this Section&nbsp;7 shall be final and binding upon the Executive,
and the Executive shall not engage in any such activities if the Company shall object. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(1)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> Do not include in an Agreement signed by the CEO.</I></FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>70</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=24,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=794098,FOLIO='70',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KQ1918A.;7',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_kq1918_1_71"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Legal Compulsion.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Notice.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Executive reasonably and in good faith believes that he or she is or may be compelled by law or by a court or
governmental agency by a proper proceeding to disclose Confidential Information and Trade Secrets, or to make a statement or take other action that would, absent this Section&nbsp;8, violate
Section&nbsp;6(f) above (each such disclosure, statement or action, a "Violation"), then the Executive shall give the Company written notice thereof as far in advance of such Violation as is lawful
and practicable, shall cooperate (at the Company's sole expense) with the Company in its efforts to prevent such Violation from being compelled, and shall limit his or her Violation to the minimum
compelled by law or court order, except to the extent the Company agrees otherwise in writing.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>No Violation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Executive complies with the foregoing procedure to the greatest extent possible without violating
applicable law, then the Executive shall not be deemed to have breached Section&nbsp;5(c) or 6(f) above, as applicable, as a result of the Violation. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Release Provisions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For the entire period of the Executive's employment by the Company, including his Retention Period, up to
the Release Date:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Release.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive understands, intends and agrees that this Section&nbsp;9 constitutes full, complete and final
satisfaction of all claims, demands, lawsuits or actions of any kind, whether known or unknown, against McDonald's and/or their respective directors, officers or employees (with McDonald's,
collectively, the "Released Persons"), arising at any time up to and including the Release Date, and the Executive hereby forever releases each Released Person from all such matters. This includes,
but is not limited to, a release of claims, demands, lawsuits and actions of any kind relating to any employment or application for employment or franchise, claims relating to resignation and/or
cessation of employment, claims alleging breach of contract of any tort, claims for wrongful termination, defamation, intentional infliction of emotional distress, personal injury, violation of public
policy and/or negligence related to employment or resignation, claims under Title&nbsp;VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended, Section&nbsp;1981 of the Civil Rights Act of 1866, as
amended, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, as amended, the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974,
as amended, the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act, the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993, the Illinois Human Rights Act, or any other state, Federal or local law prohibiting
discrimination, and claims based on any other law, regulation, or common law, whether before any Federal, state or local agency, in any court of law or before any other forum. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, the Executive's release shall not extend to any claims (i)&nbsp;for benefits under Employee Plans that are qualified under Section&nbsp;401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code,
(ii)&nbsp;for compensation or benefits to which the Executive is entitled under the Plan as provided in Section&nbsp;4 above, (iii)&nbsp;for compensation or benefits under any Employee Plan or
Compensation Plan to which the Executive is entitled by the terms thereof, except as provided otherwise in Section&nbsp;9(c) below and except to the extent such entitlements are specifically amended
or eliminated by the Plan, or (iv)&nbsp;for indemnification under the Company's policy on indemnification of officers and directors and coverage under any related insurance policies.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Advice, Time to Consider and Revocation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[The Executive is hereby advised to consult with an attorney prior to
executing this Agreement. The Executive is further advised that he/she has a period of 21&nbsp;days within which to consider the terms of this Agreement and whether or not to execute it. In
addition, for a period of 7&nbsp;days following the Executive's execution of this Agreement, he/she has the right to revoke this Agreement, and no portion of this Agreement shall become effective or
enforceable until such revocation period has expired.]</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I><SUP>(2)</SUP></I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Other Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges and agrees that the payments and benefits provided to the Executive under the
Plan are in lieu of any payments, benefits or arrangements to which the Executive might otherwise be entitled to under any Employee Plan or other plan or arrangement which provides for severance or
separation ("Other Separation Benefits"), and the Executive hereby waives any and all rights and claims that he or she may now or hereafter have to any Other Separation Benefits; provided, that the
foregoing waiver shall not apply to any right the Executive may have to any gross-up payments related to the excise tax on excess parachute payments imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the
Internal Revenue Code under any change of control employment agreement with the Company. The foregoing shall not be construed as affecting in any manner the Executive's benefits and entitlements (if
any) under any Employee Plan that provides pension or retiree medical or life insurance benefits. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<BR>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><I>(2)</I></FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=1><I> This language may be deleted or modified by the Company, depending upon individual circumstances and/or changes in law relating to age discrimination or
otherwise.</I></FONT></DD></DL>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=25,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=664578,FOLIO='71',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KQ1918B.;6',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_kq1918_1_72"> </A>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Executive acknowledges having read and understood the provisions of this Section&nbsp;9 as well as
the other provisions of this Agreement, and represents that his/her execution of this Agreement constitutes his/her knowing and voluntary act, made without coercion or intimidation. The Executive
acknowledges and agrees that the release set forth in this Section&nbsp;9 is being given only in exchange for consideration in addition to anything of value to which the Executive already is
entitled. The Executive finally agrees not to file any lawsuits against the Company or any of the released entities or persons with respect to claims covered by the release given in this
Section&nbsp;9. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>10.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Remedies.</I></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Acknowledgements.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In recognition of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information and Trade Secrets, and in
recognition of the necessity of the limited restrictions imposed by the Agreement, the Executive acknowledges it would be impossible to measure solely in money the damages which McDonald's would
suffer if the Executive were to breach any of his/her obligations under Sections&nbsp;5 and 6 above. The Executive also acknowledges that his/her breach of any such obligations would irreparably
injure the Company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Entitlement to Injunctive Relief.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Executive breaches any of his/her obligations under Sections&nbsp;5 and 6 above,
McDonald's shall be entitled, in addition to any other remedies to which McDonald's may be entitled under the Agreement or otherwise, to an injunction issued by a court of competent jurisdiction, to
restrain any breach or threatened breach, of such provisions, and the Executive waives any right to assert any claim or defense that McDonald's has an adequate remedy at law for any such breach and
any right to require, or request a court to require, that McDonald's post a bond in connection therewith.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Effect on Other Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a breach by the Executive of any of his/her obligations under this Agreement,
excluding for this purpose an isolated, insubstantial and inadvertent action, the Company shall be entitled to: </FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>discontinue
any and all payments and other benefits to which the Executive or his/her beneficiaries would otherwise be entitled pursuant to this
Agreement and/or the Plan;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>terminate
any and all unexercised stock options then held by the Executive or by any transferee of the Executive;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
the case of any such breach occurring after the Executive's Change-in-Status Date, require the Executive to repay to the
Company the aggregate amount of cash payments received by the Executive from the Company pursuant to this Agreement and/or the Plan during the period commencing on the Executive's
Change-in-Status Date and ending on the date on which the Company requests such repayment (the "Recovery Period"); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>in
the case of any such breach occurring after the Executive's Change-in-Status Date, require the Executive to pay to the
Company any Stock Option Gains (as defined in the next two sentences). "Stock Option Gains" with respect to the Executive's stock options that were not vested as of his or her
Change-in-Status Date means the aggregate amount of any gain recognized upon exercise of such stock options during the Recovery Period. "Stock Option Gains" with respect to the
Executive's stock options that were vested as of his or her Change-in-Status Date means the excess, if any, of (A)&nbsp;the aggregate amount of any gain recognized upon
exercise of such stock options during the Recovery Period, over (B)&nbsp;the amount of gain that would have been recognized, had such exercises instead occurred on the Executive's
Change-in-Status Date. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>11.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Successors.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Company and the Executive and their
respective heirs, representatives and successors.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>12.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Jurisdiction and Venue.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any action arising under this Agreement or between the Company and the Executive shall be instituted
and brought exclusively under the jurisdiction and venue of the appropriate state or federal courts for the City of Oak Brook, Illinois, County of DuPage. The Executive hereby consents to the
exclusive jurisdiction of said courts regardless of where the Executive may be domiciled at the time such suit is brought. It is further agreed that in the event the Company shall be required to
institute any proceedings to enforce the terms of this Agreement, then the Company shall be entitled to recover its attorney fees and attendant expenses as part of any recovery.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>13.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Captions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The captions of the Sections of and Exhibits to this Agreement are not a part of the provisions hereof and shall
have no force or effect. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>72</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=26,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=318719,FOLIO='72',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KQ1918B.;6',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
<A NAME="page_kq1918_1_73"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>14.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Entire Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement, together with the Plan, contain the entire agreement between the parties, and supersede
any and all previous agreements, written or oral, between the Executive and the Company relating to the subject matter hereof. No amendment or modification of the terms of this Agreement shall be
binding upon the parties hereto unless reduced to writing and signed by each of the parties hereto.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>15.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>16.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Severability.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any one or more Sections or other portions of this Agreement are declared by any court or governmental
authority to be unlawful or invalid, such unlawfulness or invalidity shall not serve to invalidate any Section or other portion not so declared to be unlawful or invalid. Any Section or other portion
so declared to be unlawful or invalid shall be construed so as to effectuate the terms of such Section or other portion to the fullest extent possible while remaining lawful and valid.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>17.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To the extent not preempted by federal law, this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in accordance
with the laws of the State of Illinois, without regard to any otherwise applicable conflicts of law or choice of law principles. </FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Executive has hereunto set his hand, and the Company has caused these presents to be executed in its name on its behalf, all as of the day and year first above written. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=28,EFW="2105107",CP="MCDONALDS CORPORATION",DN="3",CHK=74160,FOLIO='74',FILE='DISK006:[03CHI8.03CHI1918]KS1918A.;3',USER='LCOUTU',CD='11-MAR-2003;22:19' -->
